snippet: Bebars al-Talawy, who gained a measure of fame in YouTube videos documenting the war in Homs, says he is sure that a truce will mean either his surrender or death.
abstract: Skepticism on part of residents of Homs, Syria, about truce struck between rebels and security forces demonstrates challenges of convincing Syrians of any peace deal, even as international community believes truce signals way for political solution to country's civil war.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD

lead_paragraph: Bebars al-Talawy, who gained a measure of fame in YouTube videos documenting the war in Homs, says he is sure that a truce will mean either his surrender or death.

headline.main: In Besieged Syrian City, a Pastry Chef Turned Activist Fears a Truce
headline.print_headline: Wondering in Syrian City About Future After Truce
